title: OSI Model Practice Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of the seven layers of the OSI (Open Systems Interconnection) model and their functions

questions.questionText: Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions between applications?
questions.explanation: The Session Layer (Layer 5) is responsible for establishing, managing, and terminating sessions between applications.

questions.questionText: At which OSI layer do routers primarily operate?
questions.explanation: Routers primarily operate at Layer 3 (Network Layer) of the OSI model, where they make forwarding decisions based on IP addresses.

questions.questionText: Which of the following protocols operates at the Transport Layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) operates at Layer 4 (Transport Layer) of the OSI model, providing reliable, connection-oriented communication.

questions.questionText: What is the primary function of the Physical Layer in the OSI model?
options: Transmission of raw bit streams over physical medium
questions.correctAnswer: Transmission of raw bit streams over physical medium
questions.explanation: The Physical Layer (Layer 1) is responsible for the transmission of unstructured raw bit streams over a physical medium.

questions.questionText: Which layer of the OSI model handles data encryption and decryption?
questions.explanation: The Presentation Layer (Layer 6) handles data encryption/decryption, as well as data translation, formatting, and syntax.

questions.questionText: What does MAC addressing belong to in the OSI model?
questions.explanation: MAC (Media Access Control) addressing belongs to Layer 2 (Data Link Layer) of the OSI model.

questions.questionText: In which order are the seven layers of the OSI model arranged, from lowest to highest?
options: Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
Network, Data Link, Physical, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
Physical, Network, Data Link, Session, Transport, Presentation, Application
questions.correctAnswer: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
questions.explanation: The seven layers of the OSI model from lowest (Layer 1) to highest (Layer 7) are: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, and Application.

questions.questionText: Which device operates primarily at the Data Link Layer of the OSI model?
questions.explanation: Switches primarily operate at Layer 2 (Data Link Layer) of the OSI model, forwarding frames based on MAC addresses.

questions.questionText: What is the main responsibility of the Network Layer in the OSI model?
options: Providing network connectivity and path selection between systems
questions.correctAnswer: Providing network connectivity and path selection between systems
questions.explanation: The Network Layer (Layer 3) is responsible for providing connectivity and path selection (routing) between systems that may be located on different networks.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a function of the Application Layer in the OSI model?
questions.explanation: Error detection and correction is not a function of the Application Layer (Layer 7). This functionality is typically provided by lower layers such as the Data Link Layer (Layer 2) and the Transport Layer (Layer 4).

questions.questionText: Which OSI layer is responsible for flow control and error recovery?
questions.explanation: The Transport Layer (Layer 4) is responsible for flow control, error recovery, and ensuring complete data transfer.

questions.questionText: At which layer does data get converted to frames?
questions.explanation: At the Data Link Layer (Layer 2), data packets from the Network Layer are converted into frames before being transmitted over the physical medium.
